history.content:
you'll probably have more luck asking reddit or facebook's course advice page

---------

I took the Theater 118AC (online) over the summer and I really enjoyed it and found it a pretty straightforward class. However, I'm a pretty strong reader and writer (and the class requires a lot of both) so that would be something to consider. You have to watch TV as part of the class, which is pretty cool, unless you don't watch TV and should reconsider the class (and your life choices). 

---------

I'm a separate student from whoever posted the second student answer, but I had a similar experience. I managed that class with a 40 hr/ week internship + traveling and what not, so you can definitely use it to boost your gpa while learning a fair bit over the summer. Feel free to message/talk to me if you want more information

you'll probably have more luck asking reddit or facebook's course advice page

children.subject:
putting it this way: I'm a 4-unit theater class right now and our final paper is 2 pages double-spaced, and I suspect it's mostly going to be graded on effort. The upper divisions over the summer might be a little more work, but it's probably not going to be too bad.

Check the instructor though, because some of the instructors also teach with the English or Classics departments, and those classes are definitely a lot more intense than the ones who teach Theater full-time.

history.content: Hi! So I'd like to take this course as a GPA booster during summer while preparing for recruiting. Has anyone taken it before? How is it? Thanks!
history.subject: How is Theater 118AC?
